meanings.definition: A space entirely devoid of matter.
meanings.sent1: The astronaut floated in the vacuums of space.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the vacuums between stars.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the object disappear into the vacuums.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vacuum, empty of all thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum of the desert was vast and endless.

meanings.definition: A device that uses suction to clean floors.
meanings.sent1: She used the vacuums to clean the carpet.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum is essential for keeping the house tidy.
meanings.sent3: The cat was scared of the vacuum's loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum hummed as it sucked up the dirt.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum's power easily removed the crumbs from the floor.

meanings.definition: To clean with a vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent1: She vacuums the living room every Saturday.
meanings.sent2: He vacuums the office to keep it neat.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuumed the entire house while everyone slept.
meanings.sent4: She vacuumed up the spilled cereal quickly.
meanings.sent5: Vacuuming regularly helps maintain a clean home.
